trans-unit.source: Azure Backup - Offline Backup or Initial Seeding using Azure Import/Export Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup - Offline Backup or Initial Seeding using Azure Import/Export Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how Azure Backup enables you to send data off the network using Azure Import/Export service. This article explains the offline seeding of the initial backup data by using the Azure Import Export service
trans-unit.target: Learn how Azure Backup enables you to send data off the network using Azure Import/Export service. This article explains the offline seeding of the initial backup data by using the Azure Import Export service

trans-unit.source: Offline Backup workflow in Azure Backup
trans-unit.target: Offline Backup workflow in Azure Backup

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup is deeply integrated with the Azure Import/Export service which enables you to transfer initial backup data quickly. If you have TBs of initial backup data that needs to be transferred over a high latency & low bandwidth network, you can use the Azure Import/Export service to ship the initial backup copy on one or more hard drives to an Azure data center. This article provides an overview of the steps required to complete this workflow.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup is deeply integrated with the Azure Import/Export service which enables you to transfer initial backup data quickly. If you have TBs of initial backup data that needs to be transferred over a high latency & low bandwidth network, you can use the Azure Import/Export service to ship the initial backup copy on one or more hard drives to an Azure data center. This article provides an overview of the steps required to complete this workflow.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: With Azure Backup and Azure Import/Export, it is simple and straightforward to upload the data to Azure offline through disks.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Backup and Azure Import/Export, it is simple and straightforward to upload the data to Azure offline through disks.

trans-unit.source: Instead of transferring the initial full copy over the network, the backup data is written to a staging location.
trans-unit.target: Instead of transferring the initial full copy over the network, the backup data is written to a staging location.

trans-unit.source: The staging location can be a direct attached storage or a network share.
trans-unit.target: The staging location can be a direct attached storage or a network share.

trans-unit.source: Once the initial copy is completed, using the Azure Import/Export tool, this data is written to a SATA drive which is eventually shipped to the Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: Once the initial copy is completed, using the Azure Import/Export tool, this data is written to a SATA drive which is eventually shipped to the Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the size of the initial backup, one or more SATA drives may be required to complete this operation.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the size of the initial backup, one or more SATA drives may be required to complete this operation.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Import/Export tool accounts for these scenarios.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Import/Export tool accounts for these scenarios.

trans-unit.source: After the backups are written to the disk, they can be shipped to the nearest data center location for uploading to Azure.
trans-unit.target: After the backups are written to the disk, they can be shipped to the nearest data center location for uploading to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup then copies the backup data to the backup vault and the incremental backups are scheduled.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup then copies the backup data to the backup vault and the incremental backups are scheduled.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: It is important to familiarize yourself with the Azure Import export workflow which is listed <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: It is important to familiarize yourself with the Azure Import export workflow which is listed <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before initiating the workflow, ensure that a Azure Backup vault has been created, vault credentials have been downloaded, Azure Backup agent has been installed on either your Windows Server/Windows Client or System Center Data Protection Manager (SCDPM) server and that the machine is registered with the Azure Backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Before initiating the workflow, ensure that a Azure Backup vault has been created, vault credentials have been downloaded, Azure Backup agent has been installed on either your Windows Server/Windows Client or System Center Data Protection Manager (SCDPM) server and that the machine is registered with the Azure Backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Download the Azure Publish file settings from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> on the machine from which you plan to backup our data.
trans-unit.target: Download the Azure Publish file settings from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> on the machine from which you plan to backup our data.

trans-unit.source: Prepare a staging location which could be a network share or additional drive on the machine.
trans-unit.target: Prepare a staging location which could be a network share or additional drive on the machine.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the staging location has enough disk space to hold your initial copy.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the staging location has enough disk space to hold your initial copy.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you are trying to backup a 500GB file server, ensure that the staging area is at least 500GB (though a lesser amount will be used).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you are trying to backup a 500GB file server, ensure that the staging area is at least 500GB (though a lesser amount will be used).

trans-unit.source: The staging area is 'transient storage' and is used temporarily during this workflow.
trans-unit.target: The staging area is 'transient storage' and is used temporarily during this workflow.

trans-unit.source: External SATA drive writer and an external 3.5 Inch SATA drive.
trans-unit.target: External SATA drive writer and an external 3.5 Inch SATA drive.

trans-unit.source: Only 3.5 inch SATA II/III hard drives are supported for use with the Import/Export service.
trans-unit.target: Only 3.5 inch SATA II/III hard drives are supported for use with the Import/Export service.

trans-unit.source: Hard drives larger than 6TB are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Hard drives larger than 6TB are not supported.

trans-unit.source: You can attach a SATA II/III disk externally to most computers using a SATA II/III USB Adapter.
trans-unit.target: You can attach a SATA II/III disk externally to most computers using a SATA II/III USB Adapter.

trans-unit.source: Check the Azure Import/Export documentation for the latest set of drives which are supported by the service.
trans-unit.target: Check the Azure Import/Export documentation for the latest set of drives which are supported by the service.

trans-unit.source: Enable BitLocker on the machine to which the SATA drive writer is connected.
trans-unit.target: Enable BitLocker on the machine to which the SATA drive writer is connected.

trans-unit.source: Download the Azure Import/Export tool from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> to the machine to which the SATA drive writer is connected.
trans-unit.target: Download the Azure Import/Export tool from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link> to the machine to which the SATA drive writer is connected.

trans-unit.source: Workflow
trans-unit.target: Workflow

trans-unit.source: The information provided in this section is for completing the Offline Backup workflow so your data can be delivered to an Azure data center and uploaded to Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The information provided in this section is for completing the Offline Backup workflow so your data can be delivered to an Azure data center and uploaded to Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: If you have questions about the Import service or any aspect of the process, see the Import service overview referenced <link><linkText>above</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have questions about the Import service or any aspect of the process, see the Import service overview referenced <link><linkText>above</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Initiate Offline Backup
trans-unit.target: Initiate Offline Backup

trans-unit.source: As part of scheduling a backup, you will encounter the following screen (in Windows Server, Windows client or SCDPM).
trans-unit.target: As part of scheduling a backup, you will encounter the following screen (in Windows Server, Windows client or SCDPM).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ImportScreen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ImportScreen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The coresponding screen in SCDPM looks as follows.
trans-unit.target: The coresponding screen in SCDPM looks as follows.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>DPM Import screen</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>DPM Import screen</linkText>

trans-unit.source: where:
trans-unit.target: where:

trans-unit.source: Staging Location - This refers to the temporary storage location to which the initial backup copy is written.
trans-unit.target: Staging Location - This refers to the temporary storage location to which the initial backup copy is written.

trans-unit.source: This could be on a network share or on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: This could be on a network share or on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: Azure Import Job Name - As part of completing this workflow, you will need to create an Import job in the Azure portal (covered in the later part of the document).
trans-unit.target: Azure Import Job Name - As part of completing this workflow, you will need to create an Import job in the Azure portal (covered in the later part of the document).

trans-unit.source: Provide an input which you plan to use later in the Azure portal as well.
trans-unit.target: Provide an input which you plan to use later in the Azure portal as well.

trans-unit.source: Azure Publish Settings - This is an XML file which contains information about your subscription profile.
trans-unit.target: Azure Publish Settings - This is an XML file which contains information about your subscription profile.

trans-unit.source: It also contains secure credentials associated to your subscription.
trans-unit.target: It also contains secure credentials associated to your subscription.

trans-unit.source: The file can be downloaded from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The file can be downloaded from <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Provide the local path to the publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: Provide the local path to the publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: Azure Subscription ID - Provide the Azure subscription id in which you plan to initiate the Azure Import job.
trans-unit.target: Azure Subscription ID - Provide the Azure subscription id in which you plan to initiate the Azure Import job.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the ID associated with the Import job.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the ID associated with the Import job.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Account - Enter the name of the Azure storage account that will be associated with this Import job.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Account - Enter the name of the Azure storage account that will be associated with this Import job.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Container - Enter the name of the destination storage blob where this job’s data will be imported.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Container - Enter the name of the destination storage blob where this job’s data will be imported.

trans-unit.source: Complete the workflow and select Backup Now in the Azure Backup mmc to initiate the offline backup copy.
trans-unit.target: Complete the workflow and select Backup Now in the Azure Backup mmc to initiate the offline backup copy.

trans-unit.source: The initial backup is written to the staging area as part of this step.
trans-unit.target: The initial backup is written to the staging area as part of this step.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backup now</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup now</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The corresponding workflow in SCDPM is enabled by clicking on the Protection Group and choosing the Create recovery point option.
trans-unit.target: The corresponding workflow in SCDPM is enabled by clicking on the Protection Group and choosing the Create recovery point option.

trans-unit.source: This is followed by choosing the Online Protection option.
trans-unit.target: This is followed by choosing the Online Protection option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>DPM Backup now</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>DPM Backup now</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the operation completes, an .AIBBlob and .BaseBlob file is created in the staging location.
trans-unit.target: Once the operation completes, an .AIBBlob and .BaseBlob file is created in the staging location.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Prepare SATA drive
trans-unit.target: Prepare SATA drive

trans-unit.source: Download the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Tool to the copy machine. Ensure that the staging location (in the previous step) is accessible from the machine in which you plan to run the next set of commands. If required, the copy machine can be the same as the source machine.
trans-unit.target: Download the Microsoft Azure Import/Export Tool to the copy machine. Ensure that the staging location (in the previous step) is accessible from the machine in which you plan to run the next set of commands. If required, the copy machine can be the same as the source machine.

trans-unit.source: Unzip the WAImportExport.zip file.
trans-unit.target: Unzip the WAImportExport.zip file.

trans-unit.source: Run the WAImportExport tool that will format the SATA drive, write the backup data to the SATA drive, and encrypt it.
trans-unit.target: Run the WAImportExport tool that will format the SATA drive, write the backup data to the SATA drive, and encrypt it.

trans-unit.source: Before running the following command ensure that BitLocker is enabled on the machine.
trans-unit.target: Before running the following command ensure that BitLocker is enabled on the machine.

trans-unit.source: *.\WAImportExport.exe PrepImport /j:.jrn /id: /sk: /BlobType:PageBlob /t: /format /encrypt /srcdir: /dstdir: /*
trans-unit.target: *.\WAImportExport.exe PrepImport /j:.jrn /id: /sk: /BlobType:PageBlob /t: /format /encrypt /srcdir: /dstdir: /*

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: /j:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /j:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The path to the journal file.
trans-unit.target: The path to the journal file.

trans-unit.source: Each drive must have exactly one journal file.
trans-unit.target: Each drive must have exactly one journal file.

trans-unit.source: Note that the journal file must not reside on the target drive.
trans-unit.target: Note that the journal file must not reside on the target drive.

trans-unit.source: The journal file extension is .jrn and is created as part of running this command.
trans-unit.target: The journal file extension is .jrn and is created as part of running this command.

trans-unit.source: /id:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /id:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The session ID identifies a copy session.
trans-unit.target: The session ID identifies a copy session.

trans-unit.source: It is used to ensure accurate recovery of an interrupted copy session.
trans-unit.target: It is used to ensure accurate recovery of an interrupted copy session.

trans-unit.source: Files that are copied in a copy session are stored in a directory named after the session ID on the target drive.
trans-unit.target: Files that are copied in a copy session are stored in a directory named after the session ID on the target drive.

trans-unit.source: /sk:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /sk:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The account key for the storage account to which the data will be imported.
trans-unit.target: The account key for the storage account to which the data will be imported.

trans-unit.source: /BlobType
trans-unit.target: /BlobType

trans-unit.source: Specify PageBlob, this workflow will succeed only if the PageBlob option is specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify PageBlob, this workflow will succeed only if the PageBlob option is specified.

trans-unit.source: This is not the default option and should be mentioned in this command.
trans-unit.target: This is not the default option and should be mentioned in this command.

trans-unit.source: /t:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /t:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The drive letter of the target hard drive for the current copy session, without the trailing colon.
trans-unit.target: The drive letter of the target hard drive for the current copy session, without the trailing colon.

trans-unit.source: /format
trans-unit.target: /format

trans-unit.source: Specify this parameter when the drive needs to be formatted; otherwise, omit it.
trans-unit.target: Specify this parameter when the drive needs to be formatted; otherwise, omit it.

trans-unit.source: Before the tool formats the drive, it will prompt for a confirmation from console.
trans-unit.target: Before the tool formats the drive, it will prompt for a confirmation from console.

trans-unit.source: To suppress the confirmation, specify the /silentmode parameter.
trans-unit.target: To suppress the confirmation, specify the /silentmode parameter.

trans-unit.source: /encrypt
trans-unit.target: /encrypt

trans-unit.source: Specified this parameter when the drive has not yet been encrypted with BitLocker and needs to be encrypted by the tool.
trans-unit.target: Specified this parameter when the drive has not yet been encrypted with BitLocker and needs to be encrypted by the tool.

trans-unit.source: If the drive has already been encrypted with BitLocker, then omit this parameter and specify the /bk parameter, providing the existing BitLocker key.
trans-unit.target: If the drive has already been encrypted with BitLocker, then omit this parameter and specify the /bk parameter, providing the existing BitLocker key.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the /format parameter, then you must also specify the /encrypt parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the /format parameter, then you must also specify the /encrypt parameter.

trans-unit.source: /srcdir:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /srcdir:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The source directory that contains files to be copied to the target drive.
trans-unit.target: The source directory that contains files to be copied to the target drive.

trans-unit.source: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).
trans-unit.target: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).

trans-unit.source: /dstdir:<html></html>
trans-unit.target: /dstdir:<html></html>

trans-unit.source: The path to the destination virtual directory in your Microsoft Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: The path to the destination virtual directory in your Microsoft Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use valid container names when specifying destination virtual directories or blobs.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to use valid container names when specifying destination virtual directories or blobs.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that container names must be lowercase.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that container names must be lowercase.

trans-unit.source: A journal file is created in the WAImportExport folder that captures the entire information of the workflow.
trans-unit.target: A journal file is created in the WAImportExport folder that captures the entire information of the workflow.

trans-unit.source: You will need this file when creating an import job in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You will need this file when creating an import job in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>PowerShell output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>PowerShell output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create Import Job in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Create Import Job in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your storage account in the Management Portal, and click on Import/Export and then on Create Import Job in the task pane.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your storage account in the Management Portal, and click on Import/Export and then on Create Import Job in the task pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Step 1 of the wizard, indicate that you have prepared your drive and that you have the drive journal file available.
trans-unit.target: In Step 1 of the wizard, indicate that you have prepared your drive and that you have the drive journal file available.

trans-unit.source: In Step 2 of the wizard, provide contact information for the person responsible for this import job.
trans-unit.target: In Step 2 of the wizard, provide contact information for the person responsible for this import job.

trans-unit.source: In Step 3, upload the drive journal files that you obtained during the previous section.
trans-unit.target: In Step 3, upload the drive journal files that you obtained during the previous section.

trans-unit.source: In Step 4, enter a descriptive name for the import job.
trans-unit.target: In Step 4, enter a descriptive name for the import job.

trans-unit.source: Note that the name you enter may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores, must start with a letter, and may not contain spaces.
trans-unit.target: Note that the name you enter may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores, must start with a letter, and may not contain spaces.

trans-unit.source: You'll use the name you choose to track your jobs while they are in progress and once they are completed.
trans-unit.target: You'll use the name you choose to track your jobs while they are in progress and once they are completed.

trans-unit.source: Next, select your data center region from the list.
trans-unit.target: Next, select your data center region from the list.

trans-unit.source: The data center region will indicate the data center and address to which you must ship your package.
trans-unit.target: The data center region will indicate the data center and address to which you must ship your package.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>DC</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>DC</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In Step 5, select your return carrier from the list, and enter your carrier account number.
trans-unit.target: In Step 5, select your return carrier from the list, and enter your carrier account number.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will use this account to ship your drives back to you once your import job is complete.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will use this account to ship your drives back to you once your import job is complete.

trans-unit.source: Ship the disk and enter the tracking number to track the status of the shipment.
trans-unit.target: Ship the disk and enter the tracking number to track the status of the shipment.

trans-unit.source: Once the disk arrives in the datacenter, it is copied to the storage account and the status is updated.
trans-unit.target: Once the disk arrives in the datacenter, it is copied to the storage account and the status is updated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Complete Status</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Complete Status</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Completing the workflow
trans-unit.target: Completing the workflow

trans-unit.source: Once the initial backup data is available in your storage account, the Azure Backup agent copies the contents of the data from this account to the multi-tenanted backup storage account.
trans-unit.target: Once the initial backup data is available in your storage account, the Azure Backup agent copies the contents of the data from this account to the multi-tenanted backup storage account.

trans-unit.source: In the next schedule backup time, the Azure Backup agent performs the incremental backup over the initial backup copy.
trans-unit.target: In the next schedule backup time, the Azure Backup agent performs the incremental backup over the initial backup copy.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: For any questions on the Azure Import/Export workflow, please refer to this <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For any questions on the Azure Import/Export workflow, please refer to this <link><linkText>article</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the Offline Backup section of the Azure Backup <link><linkText>FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> for any questions about the workflow
trans-unit.target: Refer to the Offline Backup section of the Azure Backup <link><linkText>FAQ</linkText><title></title></link> for any questions about the workflow

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
